body:
<!-- This form is for bug reports and feature requests ONLY!

If you're looking for help check [Stack Overflow](https://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/kubernetes) and the [troubleshooting guide](https://kubernetes.io/docs/tasks/debug-application-cluster/troubleshooting/).

If the matter is security related, please disclose it privately via https://kubernetes.io/security/.
-->

**Is this a BUG REPORT or FEATURE REQUEST?**:

> Uncomment only one, leave it on its own line:
>
/kind bug
> /kind feature


**What happened**:
I wrote some client code based on the usage of the word "key" in index.go, and my code was buggy.  Then I looked more closely at index.go, and realized that it has a dichotomy but botches the naming and discussion of it.  The dichotomy is between what that file sometimes calls "values" and some of what it calls "keys".  An `IndexFunc` maps an object to a set of "values".  The `IndexKeys` method of an `Indexer` maps `(a, b)` to a slice of keys and an error, where `a` names an index and `b` is a "value".  Specifically, the resulting slice of keys are those whose corresponding object is mapped by the named `IndexFunc` to a set of "values" that includes `b`.  But the name used for this second parameter (which I have called `b` here) is `indexKey`.  Instead it should be something more like `indexValue`.  The `ByIndex` method has the same parameter naming problem.

**What you expected to happen**:

**How to reproduce it (as minimally and precisely as possible)**:


**Anything else we need to know?**:

**Environment**:
- Kubernetes version (use `kubectl version`): all of them
- Cloud provider or hardware configuration:

- Kernel (e.g. `uname -a`):

labels.name: kind/bug

title: k8s.io/client-go/tools/cache/index.go confuses keys with values
